Title:

Payment Reconciliation Functionality

Objective:

To design and implement a payment reconciliation module that automatically matches payment transactions received from external payment gateways and banks with internal accounting and order management records. The goal is to ensure financial accuracy, reduce manual effort, and enable timely identification and resolution of payment discrepancies.

Scope:

The functionality covers reconciliation of all customer payments processed through online and offline channels. It includes importing payment data from multiple sources, performing automated matching based on configurable rules, flagging exceptions, and generating reconciliation reports for review and audit.

The following systems are in scope:

Core Accounting System

Order Management System

Payment Gateway(s)

Bank Statement Integration

Out of scope:

Manual journal entry posting

Currency conversion management

Fraud detection mechanisms

Functional Requirements:

Data Import and Integration

The system shall import transaction data from payment gateways and banks through secure APIs or file uploads (CSV/XML).

The system shall fetch internal payment records from the accounting and order systems.

The import process shall be scheduled or triggered manually by authorized users.

Automated Matching Logic

The system shall match external and internal transactions based on parameters such as Transaction ID, Amount, Date, and Payment Reference.

The system shall support configurable matching rules (e.g., exact match, fuzzy match, partial match).

Unmatched transactions shall be flagged for manual review.

Exception Handling and Manual Reconciliation

Users shall be able to view, filter, and update unmatched transactions.

The system shall allow users to manually link unmatched transactions to internal records.

All manual reconciliations shall be logged with user details and timestamp.

Reconciliation Reports

The system shall generate daily, weekly, and monthly reconciliation reports.

Reports shall include totals for matched, unmatched, and partially matched transactions.

Reports shall be exportable in PDF and Excel formats.

Notifications and Alerts

The system shall notify users when reconciliation is complete or if exceptions exceed a defined threshold.

Alerts shall be configurable by role and delivery channel (email, dashboard notification).

Security and Access Control

Only authorized users shall access reconciliation data.

The system shall maintain an audit trail of all actions performed within the module.

Assumptions:

All integrated systems expose APIs or data exports compliant with required formats.

Transaction identifiers are unique across systems.

Reconciliation frequency and thresholds will be defined by the Finance team.

Payment gateway and bank data are made available on time each day.
